intro: Rhacoma ilicifolia, commonly known as the hollyleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a serrated edge, resembling those of holly. Rhacoma ilicifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
